author: Rwo1117
title: Hailfire Droid
review:
I picked up this set up at Target yesterday and seeing that nobody had reviewed it yet I decided to write my first review on this.

Box/Instructions

The box was surprisingly small and the instructions are about half of its size. But you don't care about those unless you save them like me so onto the review!

Parts

There are lots of hard to find brown and orangish-brown pieces in this set. The color scheme looks great and you have four of the missle launcher pieces, four of black connector pieces with a two-stud long axle part and a one-stud long circle connector thingy (I don't know the official name of it). Tnd had the wheel pieces also look very cool a had a print on them instead of stickers which is always a good thing

Minifigures

For the minifigures you have your two standard super battle droids and a clone trooper lieutenant that has a neat light-bluish color.

The build

The build took me about 15-20 minutes and wasn't that hard.

The completed model

The completed model looks very good in almost all aspects, except there's a ball socket piece in the back that I find to be pretty useless. Otherwise it looks great and is very sturdy.

Overall opinion

I think this is a great set for anybody who likes star wars and collecting pieces, it has lots of playability, detail, and great brown and orangish-brown pieces. The droid is an easy enough built and looks pretty cool. My only problems are it's a bit expensive for $20 and only 163 pieces (it says 171 on here but they're wrong), I don't see the point of having that ball-socket piece in the back of it, and the missile pieces fire a bit too easily.

author: Witolman
title: Needs more missiles nonetheless great set
review:
Box/Instructions

It's box is REALLY thick and sturdy, which for me is always a good thing. It seems kinda small though.

Parts

4 spring loaded shooters, and it's wheels stand out mostly. Except that we also get a lot of brown/orange pieces which I think some of them are rare.

Minifigures

There are Two Super Battle Droids and a Clone Trooper Lieutenant.

I really like Super Battle Droids minifigs, but they're pretty much un-posable. Only arms and legs piece can move, and only vertically. Also they're legs are one piece so it means no walking poses and it sometimes can be hard to make them stand on normal surface.

Clone trooper Lieutenant is awesome! Printings all over him look really good and that helmet piece is simply perfect in my opinion. The area with the vizor shines in a way it makes it look more realistic. It also has little holes for antennas on it.

The build

Quick and easy, except the segments with wheels that can be a bit annoying to build.

The completed model

The completed model looks awesome. I really like that Lego made it in brighter colors than the movie one. It's really playable. 4 spring loaded shooters add a lot to this set. It's two of them on either side with two "fake" ones so it can be attached to it's core.

However there is not enough missiles to shoot there in my opinion. Hailfire droids are always shown with about 16 missiles on each side. I know that it's impossible in this scale, but 4 more spring loaded shooters would sure be nice. The "fake" ones could be in middle and it would look and feel a lot better.

You can move it's wheel up and down a little, but it works best in it's normal position.

Overall opinion

Really good set for parts, as a model of Halifire droid (maybe even better than the normal one) and most importantly as a toy. Needs more missiles, though.
